result.execSummary:
The defendant James Joseph Bertrand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.

Any counseling assessments as recommended by the agent and follow through.
Successful completion of AODA treatment and aftercare.

timeConds.notes:
No good time.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
